page.title: 10FLETCHING BONFIRE SOCIETY
page.content: Fletching Bonfire Society was founded in 1854. There are 25 members and a committee of 20. They raise funds all year, and expect to raise Â£500 for fireworks this year. Bonfire night will be 26th October. The men dress as civil war confederates or union soldiers, the women as southern belles . They process through the village from end to end then assemble at Cherry Tree Council Estate for a firework display and bonfire. As village bonfires are very much a Sussex tradition, different costumes being chosen by each village society, many other bonfire societies join in the parade. This year there will be{ {Lindfield},{Burgess Hill},{South {Street Juveniles Lewes},{Newick}and { {Hailsham}Societies plus 2 bands, the Guy and the Societys banner. All carry flaming torches an impressive sight.
